characters: CROSSCUT WITH GILES IN MCMURRAN CONTROL ROOM
THE CABLE HOLDING HALE AND TERRY
THE OTHER PEOPLE IN THE GYM

dialogues.speaker: A FIST HITS A FACE
dialogues.text: The fist is in a boxing glove. It belongs to VIC DEAKINS, The face belongs to RAWLEY HALE, 28. They are in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale and Deakins are sparring in a ring. Other people are lifting weights, shooting baskets.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RING
dialogues.text: Hale and Deakins circle each other. Hale is shaking cobwe of his head.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: You know what happened there?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Hell, I barely know what day it is.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: I set you up. I fake right, go left three times in a row. You expect it again, I take the right in hard. That's what boxing's all about. Make your opponent think you're gonna do one thing, then do another. Like Ali in Zaire, using the rope-a-dope on Foreman. (mimes rope-a-dope) Everyone thought Ali's arms were getting destroyed, when he was really just letting Foreman tire himself out. Eighth round, Ali starts hitting, George's got nothing left -- fight's over.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: The fact that I can't feel the left side of my face -- that's okay, right? Deakins laughs. Hale seizes the relaxed moment and sudden launches into Deakins with a flurry of punches.

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER PEOPLE IN THE GYM
dialogues.text: Take notice -- the fight is getting real. They move to th

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Several of Hale's punches land. Deakins staggers back, ca off guard. It looks like he might even go down.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: He cocks his arm back. He could finish Deakins off. But h doesn't. He drops his fist.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Seizes the opportunity and slugs back.

dialogues.speaker: THE CROWD
dialogues.text: Loves it.

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Now Deakins has the upperhand. He backs Hale around the r

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Don't watch my hands -- watch my shoulders. That's where the punch starts. Ready? Deakins hits Hale hard in the face, sending him back.

dialogues.speaker: THE SPECTATORS
dialogues.text: Are circling the ring, following the fighters, cheering.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: You were looking at my hands. Let's try it again. Ready? Deakins hits Hale hard. He's got Hale on the run.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Come on. Focus. Ready? (PUNCH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My shoulders. Ready? Deakins fakes left, puts everything into one big uppercut connects.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Lands, dazed, blood trickling out of the corner of his mo

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: He's in silhouette, the lights above him.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Looks up at Deakins, catches his breath.

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Deakins offers his hand. Hale pushes it aside. Deakins ig Hale, grabs him and helps him to his feet. Deakins climbs of the ring between the ropes. Hale grabs the top rope and flips himself over, landing o feet. Deakins gives Hale a look, laughs, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale lets the water rinse the blood off his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale and Deakins are sitting on the bench between their l getting into their flightsuits, pulling on boots. Deakins smoking a cigarette. The smoke curls up into the light sl down across the room from high windows.

dialogues.speaker: HALE'S LOCKER
dialogues.text: Is in sunlight. On the inside of his locker door are pict of exotic planes -- the SR-71, a swept-wing fighter, an a rendition of the Aurora, etc.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS' LOCKER
dialogues.text: On the shady side of the room. Nothing on the inside of h locker door. The locker is spare, Zen-like in its neatnes

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: HALE'S HAND
dialogues.text: Slams a twenty dollar bill down on the bench.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: I can't take that.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Oh, shut up.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Really. I feel bad. How many times have we fought and how many times have you won?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Jerk.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Well, if you insist. Deakins grins, folds the bill and jams it into his flight

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: You know why I beat you?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Because you've been boxing for twenty years and you're much better at it than I am?

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: You don't want it enough. You had me today. I was back on my heels. But you didn't close the door.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: We were just sparring.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Life isn't sparring, Hale.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I think I saw that on a T-shirt. Deakins pulls out the twenty dollar bill; hands it back t

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: No, that's yours.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: If you weren't giving it everything you've got, then I don't want it.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: No, I mean -- that's yours, literally. I took it out of your wallet when you were in the shower. Deakins laughs, puts the money away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Planes taxiing, vehicles moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins and Hale enter to find GENERAL BOONE, 50s.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS/HALE
dialogues.text: General.

dialogues.speaker: BOONE
dialogues.text: Gentlemen. (nods at NO SMOKING

dialogues.speaker: SIGN
dialogues.text: Deak?

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Sorry. (puts out cigarette) What's the mission, General?

dialogues.speaker: BOONE
dialogues.text: Simulate a border penetration. Hug the ground. Scare some cows. See if anyone can spot you.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: The usual ...?

dialogues.speaker: BOONE
dialogues.text: No, actually, it's a little unusual. You're carrying a couple of nukes tonight, fellas. (off their looks) Palmdale's afraid low-level gamma and x-ray diffusion might screw up the peripherals. They asked us to send a couple on a run, see if anything glows.

dialogues.speaker: BOONE
dialogues.text: (shakes head) Big ones. '83s.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Ooh. Crowpleasers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BOMB TRUCK carrying two B-83 nuclear weapons drives und wing of a big, black plane, toward the open bomb bays. GR CREWMEN are hurrying about.

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Enter and walk under the plane, nodding to the ground cre and Deakins are royalty. Deakins and Hale climb up the airplane's Crew Entry steps and disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale and Deakins climb into a very strange cockpit. There two pilots' seats in this plane, with duplicate controls.

But instead of the usual dials and gauges on the control there are FOUR COMPUTER SCREENS in front of each pilot. H gets into the left seat; Deakins the right. They review information on their screens, flip switches.

dialogues.speaker: BOMBS
dialogues.text: Being loaded into the bomb bays. When they've been clampe place in the rotary bomb racks...

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: (into helmet mike) Ready for rollout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarm horns sound, wheels roll on track and the huge hang doors open revealing...

dialogues.speaker: THE GHOST
dialogues.text: An enormous black flying wing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins looks at maps on his computer screens. Hale looks sees the map of Utah.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: You know, these exercises are fantastic. I mean, when that day comes and we finally go to war against Utah, we are really going to kick ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright moonlight shows a campfire burning at the edge of escarpment, the Colorado River a thousand feet below. Nea campfire is an Army surplus tent. Next to it, an easel ho painting in progress.

dialogues.speaker: A PARK RANGER TRUCK
dialogues.text: Drives up, stops. The driver's door open, and out gets...

dialogues.speaker: A RANGER
dialogues.text: We don't see his face in the dark. He switches on a flash walks over and taps on the tent.

dialogues.speaker: RANGER
dialogues.text: Park Ranger. I'd like to talk to somebody about this fire.
We hear a man and a woman -- JIM and WANDA, 60s -- wake u

dialogues.speaker: JIM, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Wha--? Oh, hell.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'll talk to him, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: JIM, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Wanda, you stay put. Jim comes out of the tent, the ranger's light in his face

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: I know -- no wood fires in the Park. It's just -- Wanda's got a cold and I wanted her to stay warm.

dialogues.speaker: RANGER
dialogues.text: Sir, you see any other hikers, campers anywhere around here?

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Not this time of year. What's the fine for something like this?

dialogues.speaker: RANGER
dialogues.text: Your life. Jim grins. But the ranger pulls out a pistol and shoots J who falls into the fire. He then puts three shots through wall of the tent. Nothing moves. The Ranger -- call him BAKER -- pulls out a walkie-talkie, clicks on.

dialogues.speaker: BAKER
dialogues.text: Done.

dialogues.speaker: HEADLIGHTS
dialogues.text: Come on and two Humvees roll in and four men get out. Thr them -- JOHNSON, a tech-whiz; LETT, gangly, grim, and NOV a wiry guy in a baseball cap -- start setting up what loo be a high-tech missile launcher. The fourth man is...

dialogues.speaker: MR. PRITCHETT
dialogues.text: A neatly groomed man, 40s, with a perpetually sour attitu looks like -- and is -- a lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHETT
dialogues.text: (to Baker, re: Jim in

dialogues.speaker: FIRE
dialogues.text: Jesus. Do you think maybe you could get him out of the fire? Unless you like that smell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghost flies overhead, roaring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins and Hale check their screens.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: (thinks of something) Weren't you going to call Taylor today about the Aurora Project?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Turns out he wants people with more fighter hours.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: What'd you say?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: What could I say?

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Jesus. You are such a pussy. You never fight for anything. Hale is stung. Pissed, he goes on the offensive.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Yeah, well you know what your problem is?

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Because I said what your problem is, you're gonna--?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: You fight too much. (Deakins look at him) Right? You said it yourself -- you should be at least Wing Commander by now. Maybe you would be if you didn't insist on telling people what they're doing wrong all the time.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: I'm usually right though, aren't I? Hale shakes his head, grins. Deakins clicks on his mike.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Ghost 7 to McMurran. Hey, Wilkins, you old bag of dirt, your boys in Utah still awake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shot of McMurran Air Force Base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jammed with MEN looking at radar screens and computer mon COLONEL WILKINS, 50s, seen it all, talks over a headset.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: Ready and waiting, Mr. Deakins. And tell our favorite hotshot, he's not gonna lose us tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins covers his mike, turns to Hale.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Wilkins says you won't lose them tonight.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Tell Colonel Wilkins I could fly this puppy up his ass without him knowing.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: (grins, shakes his head; into helmet

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hale says ... if anyone can catch him it'd be you.

dialogues.speaker: CU RADAR SCREEN
dialogues.text: The Ghost makes a prominent blip on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: Everyone get a fix! They're about to turn out the lights!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins turns to Hale.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Ready, Major?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: On your word.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Go to war.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL PANEL
dialogues.text: The left, labeled TAKE OFF, is lighted. The other two but are MISSION and LANDING. Hale pushes MISSION.

dialogues.speaker: THE COCKPIT
dialogues.text: everything goes quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane's running lights go out. The roar of the engine quickly drops to a low rushing sound. The plane in in ful stealth mode.

dialogues.speaker: CU RADAR SCREEN
dialogues.text: The Ghost's blip disappears.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: Lost 'em on active! Who's still got 'em?

dialogues.speaker: IR CREWMAN
dialogues.text: Got their heat signature, sir. (points to computer

dialogues.speaker: SCREEN
dialogues.text: Their engines may be cold, but the air is colder.

dialogues.speaker: CU COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: Half of the screen shows a waveform, like a voiceprint. T other half shows a triangle moving across a map of Colora

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins studies the maps on the computer screens.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Descend to 400 feet AGL. River valley approach.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Airspeed lock at point-seven Mach. Blue line descent on throttle to 400 feet AGL. Hale pulls back on the throttle. The plane descends.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Time to limbo down. How low can we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghost drops away from us, a stark black cut-out again moonlit Colorado landscape. The Colorado River is a windi silver ribbon five miles below.

dialogues.speaker: A PARK RANGER TRUCK
dialogues.text: Driving along the blacktop. The driver is not Baker. It's

dialogues.speaker: TERRY CARMICHAEL
dialogues.text: Pretty, late 20s. Her radio squawks.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Terry? You been through the Needles entrance tonight?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (grabs mike, answers) No. Why?

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Mrs. Parker called --

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Oh, God. What is it this time? UFO abduction? Ritual human sacrifice?

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: She said she saw a bunch of trucks going through the Needles entrance an hour ago and thought they looked suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Yes, well, this is a woman who chopped off one of her own fingers because it'd "turned on her."

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Thing is, she said one of the trucks was ours, and you're the only one out.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (arches eyebrow) She was probably hallucinating, but I'll check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We feel the Ghost before we hear it. It rushes over, clos the river, below the ridgelines on either side of the val

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The triangle representing the Ghost disappears from a com screen.

dialogues.speaker: IR CREWMAN
dialogues.text: Lost 'em.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: Stay on it. They're gonna have to come up for air sooner or later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins reads his computer screens.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: We're under the radar. Proceed to primary target. Hale hits a button, lets go of the stick -- they're on autopilot. It's a moment of peace. Hale looks out.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I tell people I became a pilot because I wanted to fly cool planes. It's also for this. When we're up here, I feel... closer ... I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: To God? Is that what you're going to say? That you feel closer to God up here? (SNORTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, Hale, with the payload we're carrying, we are God. Deakins notices something odd on his screen. He checks be the screen and what he can see through the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Hale, take a look out your side. I think our terrain following is off. It's got us two klicks from the left flank ridge. Hale turns to look out the window on his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking out the window. There's some movement in the refl in the glass. QUICK PULL FOCUS to see, distorted in the c of the window, Deakins reaching inside his flight suit.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Turns his head back toward Deakins.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Deak, you can't smoke in here -- But then Hale sees it's not a cigarette that Deakins is p out of his flight suit. It's shiny, metal. It's...

dialogues.speaker: A GUN
dialogues.text: And Deakins levels it right at Hale's head and his finger to squeeze the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Grabs Deakins' hand, pushing up as...

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Pulls the trigger and the gun FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: The bullet cuts a line through the top of his helmet, pun a hole in the window by his head.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS AND HALE
dialogues.text: Deakins goes for another shot, but Hale grabs the gun and up, sending bullets through the ceiling of the plane, int walls. Deakins forces the gun down, fires.

dialogues.speaker: THE BULLET
dialogues.text: Tears through Hale's harness, blowing apart a shoulder st

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Hale brings Deakins' gun hand hard against Hale's own hel Deakins yowls and the gun goes flying. Then Hale sees som

dialogues.speaker: THE PLANE
dialogues.text: Is banking towards a ridge-line cliff wall.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Sees it, yanks on the stick.

dialogues.speaker: THE PLANE
dialogues.text: Banks hard away from the cliff, just missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baker gives a sign. Johnson, standing beside the missile launcher-like device, hits a button. Instead of a missile brilliant light shoots out.

dialogues.speaker: ARMAMENTS CONTROL BUTTONS
dialogues.text: Buttons include ONE, TWO, LOCK, LEFT, RIGHT, OPEN, CLOSE, and RELEASE. Deakins presses ONE and TWO, then RIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: No! He pulls at Deakins' arms.

dialogues.speaker: CU COMPUTER SCREENS
dialogues.text: Graphics of bomb racks rotate, the B-83 nukes -- labeled glowing red -- move into the bottom spot. The word RELEAS appears on the screen. Next to it, the word UNARMED flash

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Deakins hits Hale with the back of his hand, knocking him Hale grabs Deakins' helmet, yanks it off his head and sma Deakins back with it. Hale keys the armament buttons.

dialogues.speaker: CU COMPUTER SCREENS
dialogues.text: The nukes rotate out of the release position. RELEASE and UNARMED disappear.

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Deakins grabs a fire extinguisher, swings it, getting Hal the face. Hale is almost knocked out, blood running from nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry is standing by her truck, talking on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Clyde, tell Mrs. Parker that there's nothing weird going on. No truck, no UFOs, and, except for the odd human head on a stick, no sign of Satan. She feels it before she hears it or sees it.

dialogues.speaker: THE GHOST
dialogues.text: Rushes over Terry, no more than fifty feet above the grou jet-wash rocks the truck, almost knocks Terry down.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale groggy, hears a loud click. He looks down to see...

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS' HAND
dialogues.text: AUTO to MANUAL. Deakins grabs Hale's EJECTION HANDLE.

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Hale tries to push the handle down as Deakins pulls it up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heads into the beacon light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale and Deakins look at each other as the plane enters t light and the light, in SLOW MOTION, washes across their

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Suddenly lets go of Hale's hand, then hits Hale hard unde chin with the fire extinguisher.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: His head snaps back as Deakins pulls.

dialogues.speaker: HALE'S EJECTION SEAT HANDLE
dialogues.text: Pop, hiss like a huge vacuum-sealed can is being opened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ejection hatch blows and is ripped away by the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he rockets up out of the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: When the chute opens, he almost spills out because of the severed shoulder harness. He grabs the straps, holds on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry, on the radio with Clyde.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Somebody ejected!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debris -- coffee cups, flight bags, anything not nailed d is whipping around the inside of the cabin. Deakins reach through the maelstrom, then reaches to the ARMAMENT BUTTO punches them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The the clamps snap back and the two B-83s drop toward th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins looks around, then gets an idea. He hits the LAND mission mode button and the cockpit lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghost starts popping up on everyone's screens. There' chorus of "I got em!" and "They're ba-a-a-ck!" Wilkins lo a screen, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: They're not due for another halfhour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins yells into his helmet mike as he gets ready to ej

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: (into helmet mike) This is Deakins! Hale lost it! I have to punch out! Deakins pulls his second handle. BLAM! WHOOSH! He's gone. hear and feel the plane dropping, screaming toward the ea

dialogues.speaker: CU RADAR SCREEN
dialogues.text: The Ghost's blip suddenly disappears from the screen. A c of "What the hell?" and "Jesus."

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: That's not good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarm horns blare. FIVE MEN are running to a waiting Blac helicopter. Waving the men on is Wilkins. The last man up

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT COLONEL SAM RHODES
dialogues.text: 40s, short grey hair: he could snap your neck with a look Wilkins pats Rhodes on the shoulder and Rhodes jumps into

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: And it lifts up and flies off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale lies, unconscious, his parachute whipping in the win

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter glides over wind-whipped sand, searchlight Rhodes sits with MCKELLAR, the pilot. Lieutenants KELLY, and THOMAS are in the back.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SAND
dialogues.text: Something glints in the searchlights but the helicopter m

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Hold it. Come back. The lights sweep back, find...

dialogues.speaker: THE TIP OF BLACK WING
dialogues.text: Sticking out of the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AKA "The War Room." Phones, faxes, computers, TV monitors backlit maps and coffee. Present are GENERALS (including Force General CREELEY), the CHAIRMAN OF THE JOINT CHIEFS STAFF (CHAIRMAN) and ASSISTANTS, all in uniform. They tur

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: Enters. Baird, 60s, is the White House Chief of Staff. Hi assistant stays in the b.g. as Baird walks in.

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: So, do I wake the President?

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: Where is he -- Las Vegas?

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: (NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer convention. Some information superhighway crap.

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: Let him sleep for now. (hands Baird a piece of paper) We're going out with this. Rick's team prepared it. The chairman nods toward RICK. Baird reads, mumbling.

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: "United States Air Force ... regrets to announce ... C-130 heavy-lift cargo plane ... down over the Utah desert ... status of crew not determined at this time ... yadda yadda ... Nice bullshit, Rick. Baird hands it to Rick, who starts for the door.

dialogues.speaker: GILES, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: That's a mistake. The room quiets. All eyes on...

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: Baird's intensely competent assistant.

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: Giles ...?

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: Aviation Week has been following this plane's development for years. They have stringers who spend their vacations sitting in lawnchairs all night long by the Whiteman perimeter fence just in case one of these things takes off. The boys in those lawnchairs know one took off tonight. They're going to know when it doesn't come back. (MORE)

GILES (cont'd) And when we put out a press release saying a C-130 went down in Utah, they're going to put two and two together. Aviation week will run a story, everyone'll know what really happened and we're going to look real stupid. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We might as well tell the truth.

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: (mock shock) The truth? How the hell did you get this job? A few chuckles in the room. Baird looks at the Chairman - well? The Chairman thinks for a second, nods. Baird turns Rick.

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: Rewrite it. What Giles just said. Rick grits his teeth and hurries out. Baird looks at Gile

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: I want you in Utah. Now. Giles nods, heads out. Baird grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: You scare me sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: Hell, sir. Sometimes I scare myself. And out Giles goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhodes and his men are on the ground. Wind is whipping th sand. Rhodes is walking under part of the wing that is ex He's yelling into a headset microphone.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: (into mike) Cockpit's empty! We're checking the payload!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilkins talks to Rhodes over the radio.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: Watch your needles!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhodes walks up to his men who are in the process of open bomb bay doors manually. The doors are open a foot. Rhode signals his men to stop. Rhodes steps up, shines a light the bomb bays.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BOMB BAYS
dialogues.text: Rhodes' light plays over the bomb racks -- empty.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: (into headset mike) Colonel? (takes breath) We've got ourselves a Broken Arrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunned silence. They've just gotten the news. Baird does know what it means.

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: Broken Arrow?

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: That's what we call it when we lose a nuclear weapon.

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus. (thinks, shakes head) I don't know what's scarier -- losing nuclear weapons or the fact that it happens so often that you people have a term for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilkins is on the radio with Rhodes.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: Find the nukes, Sam. But be careful. I know they say those eggs can't be cracked, but if your geigers pick up more rads than you'd get off a toaster, I want you out of there. Wilkins to the CORPORAL.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: Get the teams in. I want Colonel Rhodes and his men backed up.

dialogues.speaker: CU COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: Various views of a B-83 nuclear weapon. Creeley is briefi Baird on the nukes.

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: They dropped from a plane but they didn't go off...?

dialogues.speaker: CREELEY
dialogues.text: They have to be armed to detonate.

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: Then they're destroyed?

dialogues.speaker: CREELEY
dialogues.text: (shakes head) They're designed to survive crashes intact. They can lie in a pool of burning jet fuel for five hours without any problem.

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: How did this happen?

dialogues.speaker: CREELEY
dialogues.text: In his last transmission, Colonel Deakins said Major Hale lost control. He probably hit weapons release by accident. Believe me, when a plane's auguring in, you start pushing every button you can. Baird stands, looks at a picture of a Ghost shakes his he

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: Hell, we should take the cost of the plane out of major Hale's salary. Although I guess at two billion dollars a pop, that could take a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale is still unconscious, lying beside his parachute. Th the crunch of footsteps and a FIGURE looms over Hale. The reaches down to touch Hale's shoulder and...

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Spins, grabs the shirt of the figure and cocks his arm ab punch. He hesitates when he sees it's...

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: She seizes Hale's hesitation and punches him hard.

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Hale is stunned. Terry starts to get up, reaching for her Hale strikes out with a leg, getting Terry in the gut, se her back. She hits the ground, still struggling for her g Hale gets up, runs, sprinting off over the rocky terrain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarring, racing over rock and then...

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Pulls up fast, almost not fast enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's stopped right at the edge of a fifty foot drop.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: That would be the wrong way.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Is walking slowly, calmy, up behind Hale, pistol out.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Turn around.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: (TURNING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I --

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (not interested) Gimme your hands. Hale sticks his hands behind him. Terry handcuffs them.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I'm going to tell you something I can't tell you. Terry puts away her gun, spins Hale around and starts mar him off.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: There were nuclear weapons on that plane. The guy I was flying with is trying to steal them. Terry reacts to that, but keeps Hale moving.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I have to stop him, and I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (STOPS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, pal, all I know is, I saw you come down, I come in to help you and you grab me, kick me and run away.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I only ran because you punched me.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What, we're ten years old now? "You started it. No you started it."

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: He has men on the ground. I --

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Save it. My dog's waiting for his breakfast. Terry starts to push Hale along again and...

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Jumps up and through the handcuffs.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Reaches for her revolver, but...

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Grabs it from her, puts it to-her head, but not before...

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Whips a knife from her belt and puts it under Hale's chin

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Don't move. A beat while they catch their breath.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: This isn't a stand-off, okay? I've got a gun.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I never keep my gun loaded. Terry taps her belt.

dialogues.speaker: HER BELT
dialogues.text: A line of bullets.

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Terry holds out her hand. Hale lets the revolver swing do his finger. Just as Terry takes it...

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Moves fast, grabs Terry's knife hand, then kicks her legs from under her. Hale lands on top of her, still holding h knife hand, putting the knife to her throat.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I'm telling you the truth.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: This is a good way to convince me.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I could kill you now. Right? Terry nods, bewildered and more than a little scared. Hale lets go of Terry's hand holding the knife.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I need your help. Terry looks at Hale for a long moment. She's still holdin knife. She exhales, then sticks the knife in the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter flies low. Rhodes looks at a device on his

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DEVICE'S SCREEN
dialogues.text: Green, like a radar screen. It's blank, and then two dots appear on the outer edge of the screen.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Got 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry unlocks Hale's handcuffs.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I've got a radio in the truck. We can call McMurran and get the Marines in here.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: (shakes head) Deakins'll be monitoring any radio transmissions out of here. (off her look) That's what I'd do.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Who is this guy?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: (a flash of the horrible betrayal he

dialogues.speaker: FEELS
dialogues.text: Someone I would've trusted with my life. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've gotta get to a phone.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Me? What are you going to do? (no answer, she

dialogues.speaker: REALIZES
dialogues.text: Wait. You're gonna go after this guy? Isn't he going to have a lot guns and shit? I don't want to sound insulting or anything, but ... you're just a pilot.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I don't have any choice. The nukes are my responsibility. Besides... (pulls something from

dialogues.speaker: POCKET
dialogues.text: I do have one thing going for me.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What's that? Hale sticks...

dialogues.speaker: A TWENTY DOLLAR BILL
dialogues.text: Under a rock.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: The last thing in the world he expects is for me to come after him. Hale walks off into the light of the rising sun. Terry lo the $20 bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter is parked at the edge of a deep crevice.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN IN THE CREVICE
dialogues.text: Rhodes comes down the last few feet of rope to the bottom crevice. Kelly, Thomas and Reed are waiting, shining ligh a B-83 lying in the dirt, all in one piece.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: (into mike) We've got one intact. (to his men) Let's go find the other one. Rhodes starts off along the bottom of the crevice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKellar is sitting in the pilot's seat, eating a candy b turns at the unexpected sound of a truck-driving up.

dialogues.speaker: A HUMVEE
dialogues.text: climbs up the slope toward the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: MCKELLAR
dialogues.text: Grabs his rifle, hops out of the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: NOVACEK AND LETT
dialogues.text: Are in the Humvee. Novacek sticks his head out.

dialogues.speaker: NOVACEK
dialogues.text: Hey, you guys need any help?

dialogues.speaker: MCKELLAR
dialogues.text: It's an Air Force training exercise, sir. I'm going to have to ask you to leave.

dialogues.speaker: NOVACEK
dialogues.text: Hey, no problem. We just --

dialogues.speaker: LETT
dialogues.text: Whips out a silenced rifle and shoots.

dialogues.speaker: MCKELLAR
dialogues.text: Barely has time to raise his rifle before he's hit. He dr

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER HUMVEE
dialogues.text: Drives up fast.

dialogues.speaker: BAKER, JOHNSON AND PRITCHETT
dialogues.text: Get out. Johnson wears radio headgear. Pritchett is furio

dialogues.speaker: NOVACEK
dialogues.text: Picks up McKellar's half-eaten candy bar, takes a bite.

dialogues.speaker: BAKER
dialogues.text: (to Novacek) Any sign of Deakins? Novacek, mouth full, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHETT
dialogues.text: He better be dead.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Sorry to disappoint you, Mr. Pritchett. They all look over to see...

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Walk out of the shadows, smoking a cigarette. While soldi with his men, Deakins is courteous and polite with Pritch

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHETT
dialogues.text: You said nothing would go wrong!

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Well, point of fact, nothing has.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHETT
dialogues.text: You didn't drop the nukes where you were supposed to!

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Ah, but we always planned on the search and rescue team finding the weapons for us, and they have. Mr. Pritchett, I really have thought of everything. Johnson walks up, pointing to his radio headgear.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Newsflash. Two gunships just left from McMurran and they're headed this way.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHETT
dialogues.text: You thought of that?

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: That'll take care of itself.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHETT
dialogues.text: What about the other pilot? We saw him eject.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: You don't have to worry about Major Hale. He's probably hiding behind a rock somewhere, praying I don't find him.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Someone else might find him. (off Deakins' look) A Ranger called her base, said she saw a pilot come down and was gonna go look for him. Deakins thinks it over, turns to Novacek.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Get ready. You'll go when the clean-up's done. Novacek nods, goes to the helicopter. Ext. Canyonlands - 4wd trail Hale and Terry are hurrying along a 4WD trail toward Terr truck. Terry taken a look at Hale's ripped and torn fligh

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Is that the new uniform?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Less constricting.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: The dayshift guy left some work clothes in the truck. You can have them if you want. Hale nods. His feet crunch on something.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Don't walk there.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Don't walk where?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: On that black stuff. That's cryptogamic soil. It's very fragile. One footprint takes centuries to repair.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: That's a new one. Endangered dirt. Terry gives Hale a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhodes, Reed, Thomas and Kelly move along the shadowy cre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Novacek flips switches in the helicopter, getting ready t up. Deakins reaches in, flips off a switch marked COM LIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhodes hears the connection go dead. He taps his headset.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Hello? McMurran? Come in. Suddenly, there's a soft popping sound and Reed drops.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Reed? What the --? Rhodes looks down, sees blood on Reed. Before he can say another word, there's a fusillade of soft popping sounds silenced bullets ricochet off the rock around them. Thoma down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence from the speakers.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: Sam? Sam, are you there? Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lett aims a sniper's rifle down into the crevice. He flip switch and a red laser beam stabs out from the scope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhodes and Kelly are pressed against the crevice wall.

dialogues.speaker: THE RED LASER BEAN
dialogues.text: Dances along the wall, heading for them.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Raises his pistol and shoots at the source of the laser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lett pitches back, dead.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHETT AND DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Pritchett looks at Deakins -- another part of the plan? D is unperturbed. He's holding an overnight bag. He unzips

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhodes whispers to Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: We'll open up the access panels, put in a couple grenades. The nukes won't go nuclear, but they will go dirty. I won't lie and say we'll be all right. We won't. But if we're gonna go, might as well take those bastards with us. Rhodes scrambles off.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Just one thing, sir.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: (TURNS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: This. Kelly opens fire with his rifle. Rhodes is thrown back, d Kelly yells up top.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Done! Kelly grabs the rope, climbs fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Pritchett looks at Deakins, surprised. Deakins -- put on new clothes -- just grins. Deakins takes...

dialogues.speaker: THE TWENTY DOLLAR BILL
dialogues.text: From his flightsuit and puts it into his shirt pocket.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Climbs into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly's voice comes in over the speaker.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (TERRIFIED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Wilkins? You there?

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It's Lieutenant Kelly, sir.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: What happened, Kelly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly talks over the helicopter's radio mike. Deakins is him, shaving with an electric shaver.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Colonel Rhodes is dead, sir! They're all dead!

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS, (V. 0.)
dialogues.text: What happened? Deakins puts the shaver to the radio mike. There's a wash static. Deakins pulls the shaver away, nods to Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: It's the nuke, sir! It's open! Wide open! Oh, God, what am I going to do?! Deakins puts the shaver to the mike again -- more static. reaches into the helicopter and flips off the COM LINK sw then backs away, shaving. He nods to Novacek, who fires u helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilkins slumps in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: Call back the teams and get me the Room. We're gonna need NEST in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Novacek lifts off in the helicopter and flies away. Deakins turns to Kelly and applauds his performance.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Brought a tear to my eye.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I'd just like to thank the members of the Academy.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHETT
dialogues.text: (to Deakins) I hope you've got another surprise up your sleeve. If I'm not mistaken, there are two attack helicopters headed this way.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Not any longer. They look at him; he taps his radio headgear.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNSON
dialogues.text: They've just been recalled.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: You see, Mr. Pritchett, they think they've got an exposed core. They'll want to get a satellite to take a look, but it'll take ninety minutes minimum to shift the orbit. Until then? Well, people get a little weird when it comes to radiation. No one'll have the balls to come near here unless it's NEST -- the Nuclear Emergency Search Teams --and it'll take the nearest team at least two hours to get out here, and we only need an hour to reach our connection with the transport squad. (GRINS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that I'm not delighted with your presence, but you really don't need to be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale and Terry are riding in Terry's truck. Terry drives. is wearing work clothes. After some silence...

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: What's your dog's name?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Bear. I was going to call him Death, so I could say things like, "I walk with Death," and "Death chewed my boots," but I chickened out. You?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: No dog.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Do you have a name, or is that classified? Before Hale can answer...

dialogues.speaker: THE SEARCH AND RESCUE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Rises up in front of them, Novacek piloting. Novacek thum button and machine guns on the sides open up.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY AND HALE
dialogues.text: Terry jumps on the brakes. She and Hale bail out as...

dialogues.speaker: THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: is riddled with bullets and explodes.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY AND HALE
dialogues.text: Sprint up the trail.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: We've gotta hide!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Follow me! Terry leads Hale up a short slope. Hale scrambles over th and is stunned. Terry runs out onto an open expanse -- no

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Hide where?

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Novacek grins, shoots.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Looks at the helicopter as the bullets whistle in. When h turns back, Terry's gone.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: What the --?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (O.S)
dialogues.text: Come on! Hale runs in the direction of her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aiming at Hale's back. But then Hale suddenly drops from

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Arms flailing, drops fifteen feet, to deep sand.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: This way. Terry runs. Hale follows.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: How do you --?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (looks back, still

dialogues.speaker: RUNNING
dialogues.text: I'm a Ranger. I've been over these trails a million times. Not looking, Terry runs straight into a wall, smacks her and drops like a rock.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Novacek can't see his prey. He gets an idea and reaches b

dialogues.speaker: TERRY AND HALE
dialogues.text: Terry is trying to get her eyes to focus.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Please don't tell anyone I did that.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Novacek has a box of grenades beside him. He pulls the pi a grenade and drops it.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY AND HALE
dialogues.text: Hale is helping Terry to her feet as BOOM -- the first gr goes off. They run.

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Chases them, strafing them. BOOM! -- a grenade goes off i front of them. They run back. They're cornered. Hale look around, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Can you climb up?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Yeah ...?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Give me your gun.

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF CLIFF
dialogues.text: Terry climbs up into view of...

dialogues.speaker: NOVACEK
dialogues.text: Who sees her.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Pull herself up, stands, hands up.

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Novacek swivels the helicopter around.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: This has nothing to do with me.

dialogues.speaker: NOVACEK
dialogues.text: Tell me where he is!

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Is down in the fissure, pointing the revolver straight up helicopter hovering right overhead, figuring out where to

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Blackhawk ... Moved pilot seat back a foot ... Puts him right about ... here. Hale hesitates -- he's never shot at someone before -- th takes a breath and starts shooting.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: The bullets fly up from below. One hits Novacek. He slump pushing the joystick to one side.

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Starts to lean over sideways.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Is surprised -- it worked!'

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Watches in horror as...

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER'S MAIN ROTOR BLADES
dialogues.text: Angle toward her, slicing the air as the helicopter tips

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Dives and rolls over the edge of the cliff as...

dialogues.speaker: THE ROTOR BLADES
dialogues.text: Hit the rock, sparking, grinding, right over Terry's head blades stop dead. But the torque of the motor brings...

dialogues.speaker: THE TAIL OF THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Up and over, in a high arc.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Looks up.

dialogues.speaker: THE TAIL --SECTION
dialogues.text: Is swinging over fast and the tail rotor is coming right

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Hale runs up, grabs Terry, pulls her to her feet as...

dialogues.speaker: THE TAIL SECTION
dialogues.text: Swings down, rotor spinning. It digs into the dirt and sa split-second after...

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Run clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins and Pritchett watch a fireball from the exploding helicopter rise up in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHETT
dialogues.text: We don't have to worry about the other pilot? Deakins shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHETT
dialogues.text: Then how come the helicopter crashed?

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: (a flicker of worry) Pilot error. Deakins turns and walks away, over to...

dialogues.speaker: BAKER AND KELLY
dialogues.text: Who have taken the three-foot, pointed, front section off nuke. They are loading them into the back of one Humvee. Pritchett walks up behind Deakins, still nagging.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHETT
dialogues.text: Tell me again how I don't need to be here.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Mr. Pritchett, I understand your concerns. You and your associates gave me a lot of money to mount this operation. But they're getting ten times that back if we succeed.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHETT
dialogues.text: If we succeed?

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: All I can do is my part. We've got the weapons, we're ... (checks watch) ... seventeen minutes ahead of schedule and everything will be in place within two hours. But I can't guarantee that the assholes in Washington won't do something stupid like not pay.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHETT
dialogues.text: What if they don't?

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Then the next census for this region is going to show a very sudden drop in population.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giles enters and is brought over to Wilkins.

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: Colonel Wilkins? I'm Giles Prentice. (they shake hands) My word from your search and rescue team?

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Picked up any radiation? Wilkins shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: That's kind of strange -- if there's an exposed core out there.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: Point?

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: Probably nothing. I asked for a transcript of the last cockpit transmission...? Wilkins nods to a CORPORAL who hands some papers to Giles reads them quickly.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: I don't know what you expect to find.

dialogues.speaker: CU TRANSCRIPTS
dialogues.text: We see COLONEL DEAKINS: "This is Deakins! Hale lost it! O God! I have to punch out!"

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: You know these guys? The pilots?

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: Just on the radio. Never met 'em. Why?

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: (looks up) What if this wasn't pilot error?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baird has put Giles on speaker phone. The people in the Situation Room exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: No rhetorical questions, Giles. Spit it out.

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: In the last transmission from the plane, Colonel Deakins said Major Hale lost it and made the plane crash. We all assumed that meant pilot error. But what if Deakins meant Hale made the plane crash. Murmurs of "That's insane" "No way" fill the room.

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: Why would he do that?

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: Two nuclear weapons would be worth a hell of a lot of money.

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: To whom? Son, there are easier ways for someone to buy nuclear weapons. You go to one of the old Soviet republics, you can get one for the price of a BMW.

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: I meant they'd be worth a lot of money to us. How much would we pay to get them back? To make sure they weren't used in this country? A flurry of looks around the room.

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: Hold on, hold on. (to Creeley) These nukes have codes or something that prevent people from using them.

dialogues.speaker: CREELEY
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: No one has these codes -- outside of the President and you guys.

dialogues.speaker: CREELEY
dialogues.text: Access to the codes requires the highest security --

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: I mean, not even the pilots have these codes, right?
Creeley starts to stammer. Baird slumps. The chairman tur

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: (to an assistant) Where's that NEST team now?

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: They just took off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sleek, very serious-looking helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIX very serious-looking SOLDIERS are in black radiation listening to COLONEL HUNT, 45, over headsets.

dialogues.speaker: HUNT
dialogues.text: Listen up, sportsfans. Word is, this particular broken arrow has broken open. Our ETA Utah is ninety-six minutes. I want everyone to take that time to triple-check the seams and seals on their E-suits. Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giles looks at Wilkins.

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: You think I'm nuts. You don't think NEST or the satellite will find anything weird.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: That's right. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it wouldn't hurt to get some gunships fueled just in case. Wilkins reaches for a phone. Giles smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter wreck burns. Hale looks over the terrain.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: How do they get out of here?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Get out? I don't think that helicopter's going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Deak'd have a back-up. He'd be prepared.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: If they've got trucks they could take the four-wheel-drive trail we were on.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: He wouldn't want to go towards town.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: He could go to the river. Hale looks at Terry -- that's exactly what Deakins would

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Humvees roll along the narrow, twisting trail.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SECOND HUMVEE
dialogues.text: Kelly drives, Deakins beside him, Johnson and Pritchett i

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: You a fan of boxing, Mr. Pritchett?

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHETT
dialogues.text: I think it's barbaric.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Me, too! I love it! Two men trying to do as much damage to the other as he can. As basic as you can get, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHETT
dialogues.text: I think it should be banned.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: So do I! God, wouldn't that make it more exciting? Having to go into dark alleys and basements to see a fight? I bet we see eye-to- eye on a lot of things, Mr. Pritchett. Deakins grins; Mr. Pritchett steams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale and Terry stand on an outcropping overlooking the 4W

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Humvees make their way along the trail.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: See the one in front? It just has a driver? They wanted to keep the weight down. It has the nukes. Hale takes Terry's gun from her.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You gonna shoot out the tires?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Humvees can reseal and inflate with the flick of a switch. That's why Deak chose 'em. Terry looks at Hale -- then what is he going to do?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I'm gonna steal it. (checks gun) You get to a phone and call McMurran.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: The nearest phone is a two-hour walk.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Then you better start walking.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Look, I know my way around here. You're gonna need me.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: (very serious) I appreciate what you've done so far. But now it gets hairy. Go to the phone. He scrambles off over the rock.

dialogues.speaker: THE HUMVEES
dialogues.text: Come around a corner. The trail hugs the face of a ten-fo high cliff. Suddenly, from off the cliff...

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Jump down onto the roof of the lead Humvee. Hale looks at Terry, angry. But before he can say anything...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HUMVEE
dialogues.text: Baker swerves, trying to throw them off. He pulls out a p shoots up through the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Bullets punch up. Hale pulls out the gun. It falls from h hand. Terry grabs it as a sharp swerve sends...

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Flying. He lands hard behind the Humvee.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SECOND HUMVEE
dialogues.text: Deakins points at Hale, getting to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Run him down.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Sprints after the leading Humvee. Deakins' Humvee closes

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Looks back, sees Hale's predicament.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Here! She slides the pistol along the truck roof.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Grabs the gun out of the air as...

dialogues.speaker: BAKER
dialogues.text: Slams on the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Comes flying off the top, landing on the hood, barely hol

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Is going to be crushed between the Humvees. He jumps up, turning, as the bumpers come together. He lands on the ta facing backwards and fires into Deakins' windshield.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS AND KELLY
dialogues.text: Kelly ducks below the dash and slams on the brakes but De doesn't flinch. The bullets bounce off the glass --bullet

dialogues.speaker: IN THE LEAD HUMVEE
dialogues.text: Baker sticks his gun out the window and aims at Terry and to pull the trigger when he stops, feeling a gun against back of his head.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Is behind him. Hale gets into the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Gimme the gun and get out.

dialogues.speaker: BAKER
dialogues.text: (SMIRKING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I think we got ourselves a little stand-off.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: No, we don't. Hale shoots Baker in the thigh. Baker howls.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Reaches forward and grabs Baker's gun as...

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Kicks Baker out of the Humvee.

dialogues.speaker: BAKER
dialogues.text: Bad timing for him. He tumbles out, right in front of...

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS' HUMVEE
dialogues.text: And is run over.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Holds the steering wheel, yells to Terry.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: You drive!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Climbs into the Humvee, takes the wheel from Hale. She ja Baker's gun into her belt.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I'd yell at you for coming after me, but you did just save my life.
There's a look between them, then Hale climbs into the ba finds what he is looking for -- a jerry can of gasoline a emergency tool box.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: What're you doing, Hale?

dialogues.speaker: IN HALE AND TERRY'S HUMVEE
dialogues.text: Hale keeps his back to the other Humves. He pulls gaffer' off a roll, tears it with his teeth, grabs...

dialogues.speaker: A FLARE
dialogues.text: Out of the tool kit.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Maybe he'll set off a nuke. That'd show us.

dialogues.speaker: BETWEEN THE HUMVEES
dialogues.text: Hale tosses the jerry can of gasoline out the back of the

dialogues.speaker: THE JERRY CAN OF GASOLINE
dialogues.text: Flies through the air. There's a burning flare taped to t side of the plastic can.

dialogues.speaker: ECU TIP OF FLARE
dialogues.text: As the plastic of the can bubbles and melts and...

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Stop! But it's too late and...

dialogues.speaker: THE JERRY CAN
dialogues.text: Explodes.

dialogues.speaker: THE SECOND HUMVEE
dialogues.text: Skids to a stop, showered with burning gasoline. Deakins his men bail out. Kelly, Johnson and Pritchett run for co

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Coolly grabs a fire extinguisher and starts spraying.

dialogues.speaker: IN HALE AND TERRYS HUMVEE
dialogues.text: Hale climbs up into the front seat. Terry looks at him, genuinely impressed.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: We need somewhere to hide.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (THINKS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know a place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins keeps spraying the burning Humvee with foam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Hale have taken the Humvee to the parking area front of an abandoned mine. The winch on the Humvee strai The cable is attached to the handles on the padlocked met doors. The doors are slowly pulling out, groaning.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: It was a copper mine, barely squeaking along for years. They shut it-down a few months ago when they hit an underground river. The hinges on the metal doors buckle and snap and the doo loose. Hale shuts down the winch, unhooks it from the doo He motions for Terry to drive it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry drives the Humvee into the mineshaft entrance. Hale a flashlight to look around. He finds a switch a flips it gas generator comes to life. Another click and lights com Now they can see the rest of the entry area, including a mesh-enclosed elevator. As Terry looks around, Hale grabs Humvee radio, tries to tune in other frequencies, gives u

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: They hardwired in their frequency. We can't call out.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What are we gonna do? Hale goes to the back of the Humvee, pulls down the tailg

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I'm gonna take away Deakins' reason for being here. Hale grabs a screwdriver from the tool kit and pries open panel on the side of one of the B-83s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an LCD DISPLAY, a NUMERIC KEYPAD and a CLOCK show current time. The keys are oversized and brightly colored

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Fisher-Price makes nuclear weapons?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: They're designed to be used by guys wearing gloves in Alaska. He reaches in, hits a key and the LCD display lights up.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: These nukes have security codes. If you enter the wrong code three times, the nuke goes dead -- all the circuitry shorts out and shuts down. Kind of like the security systems with car radios.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: And people say the public doesn't benefit from defense spending.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: (GRINS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand me the radio. Terry goes for the radio mike. Hale sees something.

dialogues.speaker: A PLASTIC NAME TAG
dialogues.text: Sticking out from under one of the nukes.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Pulls it out, looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: ECU NAMETAG
dialogues.text: It's from "St. Judes Hospital, Radiology Department."

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Hale turns to Terry as she pulls over the radio mike.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Where's St. Judes Hospital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire is out. The radio crackles.

dialogues.speaker: HALE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Deak -- you there?
Deakins and Kelly look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: HALE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ding, ding, ding, Deak. We're starting a new round. You took the first couple, but I've got you on the ropes now, you son of bitch. Deakins gets in the passenger side, grabs the radio mike.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Hey, there. What was that last part? There was some static. (clicks off mike; to

dialogues.speaker: JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Find them. (to Pritchett and

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Let's go! Johnson pulls out a radiation detector scanner like the o Rhodes used. Kelly and Pritchett get back in the vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: CROSSCUT BETWEEN HALE AND DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Kelly drives Deakins' Humvee along the trail as they talk

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I know you're stalling while you try to find the nukes with your scanner, but you're gonna be too late. Hear that? Hale holds the radio mike up to the keypad as he enters n

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I'm entering the wrong code, you bastard. A couple more times and these are gonna be useless to you.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: You really got me there. I sure didn't think of that. Hale slows down -- something's wrong -- Deakins doesn't c

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: All that time we spent in the cockpit together and you think I'm stupid? I got some new boards and circuits from a friend at Pantex. But nice try. Hale curses to himself. Terry looks at him. He shakes his they're in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: You know, Hale, I thought of asking you to join me on this. You wanna know why I didn't?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Because I would've said no?

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: I would've just killed you if you said no. I was more afraid you'd say yes. Because I knew I couldn't count on you. You can pretend you've got guts, but when and if it comes down to it, you're gonna run off crying like a little girl.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: You better hope that's true, Doak. Because I've got the nukes, and there's nothing to stop me from entering the right code, if you know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: (flash of worry) You wouldn't do that.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Nah. You're right. I wouldn't have the guts. END SPLIT-SCREEN. Hale drops the mike; looks at the eleva

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: How deep is this mine?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I don't know. A couple thousand feet.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: That's deep enough. Hale opens the elevator gate.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: A nuclear explosion. Terry's jaw drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly drives the blackened Humvee as fast as he can. John looks at his scanner, grins.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Got it! They're --

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: In the mine. (off their looks) I could tell he was inside something. There was an echo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale hurries to the back of the Humvee.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: We can still hide them!

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: He's got a scanner. He'd find them.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You're talking about setting off a nuclear weapon!

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: They set them off underground in Nevada all through the fifties and sixties. There's no risk.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Tell it to the two-headed cows. Hale grabs the straps around one of the nukes, pulls. He barely move the thing. He turns to Terry.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: No! I am not helping you set off a nuclear weapon.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: We won't be down there when it goes off. This isn't a suicide mission.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: (IMPATIENT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Fine. Though I think you should know, before I ejected, I heard Deakins say the nukes were going to be used to wipe out the last few remaining handicapped gay whales. Terry looks at him -- you asshole. Hale looks at her, ver serious.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I need your help. Terry thinks, shakes her head, steps up and grabs the nuk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Humvee takes the turn-off to the mine entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale and Terry are going down with the nukes.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: When we get to the bottom we'll have to get away from this shaft. It'll limit the amount of radiation released into-the atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins's Humvee comes into the clearing. The Humvee stop Deakins and Kelly jump out, followed by Pritchett and Joh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator comes down. Hale slides open the gate. He an Terry drag the nukes out.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: We'll each drag one down a tunnel?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: No. I'm only going to set off one. We'll leave the other one here. It'll be buried under a billion tons of rock. They are startled when the elevator starts going up behin

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: We better hurry. (nods down tunnel) Let's try down there.
They start hauling the nuke down the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins, Pritchett, Kelly and Johnson wait by the elevato

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHETT
dialogues.text: I can't wait to see how this fits into your plan. Deakins' charm peels away for an instant and he fixes Pri with a stare. Pritchett shrinks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baird, the Chairman and the others are watching large TV monitors. Creeley walks them through what they're looking

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MONITORS
dialogues.text: A wide-view, bird's-eye, thermal image of rocky terrain.

dialogues.speaker: CREELEY
dialogues.text: This is the KH-12 satellite's infrared view of the area. An exposed nuclear core would be relatively hot -- it'd show as a circle of bright white. As you can see, there's nothing. The only heat signatures we found were these. The image changes. There are four blotches, glowing a dul

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: What's --?

dialogues.speaker: CREELEY
dialogues.text: We think it's Colonel Rhodes and his men. Their bodies. A look between Baird and the Chairman. The Chairman reach a phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilkins is on the phone. Giles looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: I understand, sir.

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: (WHISPERS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was I right? Wilkins nods. Giles grins smugly for about half a second, realizes what it really means.

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: Oh, shit.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: (into phone) I've got ten ships ready to go ... We should be hearing from NEST any minute now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flying over Canyonlands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins, Kelly and Johnson are in the elevator. Kelly hol small metal briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale and Terry have stopped at the end of a tunnel. Hale opened the guts of the nuke. He's pulling out a chip.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: How do you know how to do this?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Pilots who fly with nuclear weapons have standing orders to ... (quoting from the

dialogues.speaker: MANUAL
dialogues.text: ... "retrieve if possible, disable if necessary and destroy if we must," and destroy I must. He stands, looks around. He sees...

dialogues.speaker: EYEBOLTS
dialogues.text: Screwed into the cross beaus on the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I'm gonna need your belt and one of your socks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator descends into view. Deakins, Kelly and Johns out. They see the other nuke lying there.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Send it up?

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: (shakes head) Let's take care of Hale first. Spread out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one hand Hale holds Terry's sock, filled with sand. Hi other hand grips the eyebolt. Terry is giving Hale a log straining under the weight.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Take your time. Really. Hale has pushed the open end of the sock through the eyeb tightens a belt around the open end of the sock.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Okay. Terry lets Hale down. Hale picks up a big rock and loops free end of the belt around it. Then he picks up a smalle

dialogues.speaker: NUCLEAR WEAPON
dialogues.text: One chip has been pulled out of a circuit board. Hale ver gingerly lays the small rock on top of the chip.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: We make a small hole in the sock, and when enough sand drains out -- and we're hopefully in New Mexico -- the sock is pulled through the eyebolt, the rock drops... (re: smaller rock) ... hitting the rock on this chip, closing the firing circuit and that's it. Hale finishes putting the small rock in position. He stan

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: How much time are we going to have?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I don't know precisely. This isn't a Swiss sock. Ten minutes, maybe -- Hale is cut off by...

dialogues.speaker: BULLETS
dialogues.text: Flying in, ricocheting off the rock walls, fired by...

dialogues.speaker: JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Thirty yards down the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Dive to the ground. They pull pistols, start shooting.

dialogues.speaker: THE SOCK
dialogues.text: One of Johnson's bullets cuts through it.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Feels sand hitting his face, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sand is draining out of the sock very fast.

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Reaches up to grab the big rock, but Johnson sends a spra bullets in. Terry grabs Hale.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: The sock -- More bullets. Terry pulls Hale. They run down a side pass Hale and Terry fire back at Johnson as they run out of si

dialogues.speaker: JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Shoots after them, then runs up to the weapon. He reaches the rock, stops -- maybe that'll set it off.

dialogues.speaker: THE SOCK
dialogues.text: The last sand pours out; the sock is sucked through the e

dialogues.speaker: THE ROCK
dialogues.text: Drops fast toward the nuke.

dialogues.speaker: A HAND
dialogues.text: Grabs it, stopping it just in time. The hand belongs to..

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: He looks at Johnson in disgust, exhales, and tosses the r pulls out a walkie-talkie, clicks on, talks into it.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: We're at the end of tunnel three. (clicks off; to

dialogues.speaker: JOHNSON
dialogues.text: You two get this one set. I'll take the other one up.

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Running along a tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Beat 'em back to the elevator. Stop 'em from getting out. Terry nods. They hurry off around a corner and are met by

dialogues.speaker: A FLURRY OF BULLETS
dialogues.text: Fired by...

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: With his Uzi.

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Run back down the side tunnel, bullets winging off the ro around them, shooting back. Hale starts shooting out the lights, plunging the tunnel into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Slows down.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: The bit with the sock was good. I like it. Still, I'm gonna use the the Field Expedient Tactical Timer. It's a little more precise. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, Hale -- you aren't the only one who's thought of setting off a nuke in this mine.

dialogues.speaker: BY THE NUKE
dialogues.text: Kelly is there with Johnson. Kelly flips on a lamp on a headstrap, giving him better light as he opens up the met briefcase he's been carrying.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BRIEFCASE
dialogues.text: An elaborate electronic timer.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TUNNELS
dialogues.text: Deakins pulls out a fresh clip.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: I need a demonstration. Otherwise, some swinging dick in Washington is going to say I don't have the balls or the ability to set off a nuclear weapon. I'm gonna show these puppies I'm ready, willing and able. Hell, I'm eager. Deakins jams in his clip, walks into the dark part of the

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: In the dark, waiting to ambush Deakins and then...

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Opens fire -- but not at Hale and Terry -- at the cable a the ceiling connecting the lights. The cable snaps and electrical sparks shoot out, flooding the tunnel with lig showing...

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Suddenly exposed to Deakins' fire. The bullets whiz in.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: The muzzle flashes from his Uzi give away his position an and Terry's bullets scream in at him. He backs around a c

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Take cover. It's a stand-off.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
