dialogues.text: Well, Hale, I better be going. Look at it this way, partner. If you wanted to get closer to God, you are about to get your wish. Hale hears Deakins' footsteps start off.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: You're gonna ransom Salt Lake City, aren't you? The footsteps stop.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: What makes you think that?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: That's where St. Judes Hospital is. You're gonna hide the nukes near the radiology department so they won't show up an any satellite radiation scans.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: I'm impressed.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: How much are you gonna ask for?

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Enough. I've got a broker in Stockholm. Monday morning he's going to buy me five percent of Volvo. For the rest of my days I'm going to live off the dividends, happy in the knowledge I'm helping to build the safest car in the world.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: So that's it? You're just doing 'this for the money? I'm kind of disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Why would you do it, Hale?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: That's the thing -- I wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: If you were me.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: If I were you...? (thinks, starts in) Because ... because I got passed over for promotion and goddamnit I'm going to show the bastards that I'm smarter than them all. (getting angry) Because ... everyone's selling out and cashing in, so why not me? (ANGRIER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because ... because my ex-wife was sleeping around. Because my parents abused me. Because I ate some sugar. (MORE)
HALE (cont'd) (FURIOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I don't like Mondays. (takes a breath,

dialogues.speaker: GRINS
dialogues.text: It's all bullshit, Deak. There are no reasons. Not really. There's no difference between you and the guy who shoots up the schoolyard with an M-16. You both think you have reasons. You both think you were wronged. The truth? You're both just fucked in the head.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS' FACE
dialogues.text: Grim, evil -- fades into darkness as he turns and walks o

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: They hear footsteps, receding. Hale bolts out of their hi spot. Terry follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins gets to the elevator, drags the other nuke in, sh gate and starts up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly finishes keying in numbers into the nuke timer. An light comes on and...

dialogues.speaker: THE TIMER
dialogues.text: Starts ticking down from ton minutes.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY AND JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Grab their guns and run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator comes up. Deakins drags out the nuke, hits t DOWN button, shuts the gate. The elevator descends.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Mr. Pritchett!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale and Terry are waiting for the elevator to come down

dialogues.speaker: KELLY AND JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Run in. A half-second of surprise is broken when...

dialogues.speaker: THE ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Comes down.

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Make a move toward the elevator, but...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY AND JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Unload with their Uzis.

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Back around a corner, side by side, shooting their pistol

dialogues.speaker: JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Is shot, drops.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Grabs Johnson's Uzi and, firing both guns, backs to the elevator, kicks open the gate with his foot and gets insi hits the UP button with the butt of one of the guns and t elevator starts to rise.

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Step out of the tunnel and fire on the climbing elevator.

dialogues.speaker: ECU NUKE TIMER
dialogues.text: Seven minutes and counting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins and Pritchett get the nuke into the back of the H

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: We can go back, try to shut it down.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: We don't know the code, and Deak'd have it wired to blow if we so much as look at it funny.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Then we're... Hale looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I shouldn't've let you come.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Oh, God. Hale takes Terry in his arms, holds her.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I ... I just hope someone remembers to feed my dog. Hale nods, hugs Terry. Terry starts to say something else Hale puts a finger to his lips -- he's heard something -- distant rushing.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Come on. Hale pulls Terry, running, down the far tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What're you --?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: You said they shut down the mine when they hit an underground river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins slams the tailgate on the Humvee shut. From the distance, he and Pritchett hear the whump-whump-whump of helicopter. Deakins motions Pritchett to stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins comes out, looks up, sees...

dialogues.speaker: THE NEST HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Coming toward him, two miles away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunt sees something, points.

dialogues.speaker: HUNT
dialogues.text: Ten o'clock! In the clearing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blackened Humvee and Deakins by the mine entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale and Terry run up. The tunnel comes to an end at a bi hole. The rushing sound comes from the hole. They step up to the edge and look down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark water rushes by ten feet below them.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Any idea where it goes?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: No. They look at each other. They don't have any choice. They flick on their flashlights and jump. They-hit the water a swept from view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins enters, motions for Pritchett to get into the Hum

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Get in. We're leaving.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHETT
dialogues.text: (re: Kelly and

dialogues.speaker: JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to wait for them?

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: No time. And if they get out, they might talk. Fortunately, there's something wrong with the elevator. Deakins opens fire with his Uzi on the generator. Sparks and the thing shuts down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly is jarred when the elevator stops and the lights di

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins and Pritchett drive out of the mine in the Humvee Deakins punches the trip odometer, setting it to zeroes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly switches on his headlamp.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Wrong person to screw with, Deak.
He pulls open the gate and climbs down.

dialogues.speaker: THE ELEVATOR SHAFT
dialogues.text: Kelly swings under the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I know the goddamn code, asshole. He grabs the cable trailing off below the elevator and st sliding down it into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: ECU NUKE TIMER
dialogues.text: Two minutes and counting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale and Terry are being sucked along through the fast, turbulent water. Their flashlights show...

dialogues.speaker: STALACTITES
dialogues.text: Jutting down like knives, ready-to rip then open.

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Dodge them, push off, duck under. And then they notice th

dialogues.speaker: THE CEILING
dialogues.text: Is getting lower, getting closer to the surface of the wa They're running out of breathing room. Three feet, two fe one foot. They take big breaths, maybe their last, and they're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tumbling along, pulled at by the eddies, flashlights show their faces -- they are running out of air. And then, the light above them in the water.

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Lungs bursting, they start kicking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Hale come to the surface, coughing, sucking in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins drives fast along the 4WD trail, glancing in his sideview mirror at...

dialogues.speaker: THE NEST HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Closing in on him.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHETT
dialogues.text: Is holding on tight as Deakins drives wildly.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHETT
dialogues.text: I think I've finally figured out your plan. Those guys in the helicopter are going to kill us, but we're going to rise from the dead and

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Very suddenly and very violently lashes out. The side of hand hits Pritchett in the throat.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHETT
dialogues.text: Gags silently, suddenly unable to get any air. He pulls a throat, even pounds himself in the back of the neck. No g slowly slumps, dying, skin turning blue.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Maybe now you'll shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly is running as fast as he can, headlamp lighting the

dialogues.speaker: ECU NUKE TIMER
dialogues.text: Thirty seconds and counting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale and Terry are swimming toward the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins barrels along in the Humvee, the NEST helicopter closer behind him.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HUMVEE
dialogues.text: Deakins has a thought and looks over at Pritchett, dead, by the seatbelt.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: I just realized I've never killed anyone before. I mean, I dropped bombs on Baghdad, but never face to face. (MORE)
DEAKINS (cont'd) (thinks about it,

dialogues.speaker: SHRUGS
dialogues.text: I don't know what the big deal is.

dialogues.speaker: ECU NUKE TIMER
dialogues.text: Eighteen seconds left.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Runs up, starts entering numbers into the timer keypad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NEST helicopter closes fast on Deakins. They are a co hundred feet above him, a quarter mile back.

dialogues.speaker: HUNT
dialogues.text: Let him know we're here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A line of bullets kicks up dust in front of Deakins' Humv

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins looks at...

dialogues.speaker: THE TRIP ODOMETER
dialogues.text: It clicks over from 2.9 to 3.0 miles.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Grins, steps on the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Humvee stops and Deakins gets out, arms above his hea

dialogues.speaker: THE NEST HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: A hundred feet in the air, slowly coming in toward Deakin

dialogues.speaker: ECU NUKE TIMER
dialogues.text: Eleven, ten, nine...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Punches in the last two numbers of the code then ENTER.

dialogues.speaker: ECU NUKE TIMER
dialogues.text: It stops with seven seconds left. The amber light goes of the red light comes on.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Sits back on the floor, takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins is watching the helicopter. Strangely, he is grin Then the camera CLOSES IN fast on...

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS' HAND
dialogues.text: He's holding a small black box. He presses a button and..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly hears a click. He looks over at...

dialogues.speaker: THE TIMER
dialogues.text: The red light goes out. The amber light comes on. A split later, the green light comes on.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Oh shit. The screen goes white.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Watching the helicopter, listening to Hunt over the louds

dialogues.speaker: HUNT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Do not move or you will be fired --

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUND
dialogues.text: Rises up beneath Deakins.

dialogues.speaker: WIDE SHOT
dialogues.text: The ripples of the shockwave shoot out from the mine, sha dust and dirt into the air with an incredible, deafening

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS AMD THE HUMVEE
dialogues.text: Fly ten feet into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a roar of static over everyone's headphones and t every light, every piece of electronic equipment shuts do

dialogues.speaker: HUNT
dialogues.text: No...! They plummet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Hale are pulling themselves out of the water wh shockwave hits, knocking them off their feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilkins and Giles hear the sudden rumble and then the sho hits, knocking stuff off desks, swinging lamps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins and the Humvee land. In the b.g...

dialogues.speaker: THE NEST HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Drops out of sight behind a rock formation. There's an explosion and a ball of fire shoots up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry looks over at Hale -- holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lamps are still swinging.

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: That's all we need. A goddamn earthquake.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: Son, I was at the Nevada Test site in the fifties. That wasn't an earthquake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins picks himself up.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: (to himself) At least I know they work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilkins grabs a phone. Giles is pacing, freaked.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: (into phone) Get me the Room.

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: I have to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: You're going to be fine. It was underground. (into phone) Colonel Wilkins for General Creeley.

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: For one thing, if it was above ground, it wouldn't have caused the same kind of ground tremor. For another, if it was above ground, we'd all be blind and dying. (into phone) Sir, we've just had a detonation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bedlam. People yelling. The Chairman is huddling with Bai

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: How'd that happen?

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: I don't know, but thank God it happened underground.

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: What do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: First thing we do is put a huge goddamn lid on this thing. With all due respect to your boy Giles and his belief in honesty as the best policy, from now on and until the end of time, what happened in Utah tonight was an earthquake. All right? Baird nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Humvee races along the trail.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HUMVEE
dialogues.text: Deakins and the dead Pritchett motor along. Deakins turns Pritchett as if Pritchett had just asked him a question.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: The helicopter? It was hit by EMP. Electromagnetic pulse. It's released in a nuclear detonation. It wipes out anything electronic for miles. That"s another reason I wanted to set off a nuke. I knew it'd bring down any helicopters coming for us. It'll also shut down all radio communications for a few hours, which will severely screw up their response. (GRINS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, Mr. Pritchett? There really is nothing for you to worry about. Pritchett's body seems to nod from the motion of the Humv

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERFLIES
dialogues.text: Hover and dance over the water in the early morning light

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Hale has his shirt off and is wringing it out.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Goddamn it! He turns to see Terry trying to undo her buttons but unab her fingers are too numb.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Stupid buttons. I hate these shirts. They're ugly and stupid and -- Terry suddenly starts crying. It's not the shirt she's up about. Hale holds her.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: We just ... I mean, we almost...

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: A nuclear bomb went off.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: That it did.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Are we...?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Look. (points at

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERFLIES
dialogues.text: If the butterflies are okay, then we'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Absolutely. It says so in the manual. "If you see butterflies after a detonation, you are fine." Terry looks at Hale. She knows he's bullshitting her, but appreciates it. They look at each other. They could kiss but they both shy away from it. Terry gets her shirt off.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: We better get moving. We might be able to reach Deakins when he gets to the river. They start off along a trail by the river.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Something I've been meaning to ask. (Terry looks at him) How did someone like you end up with a gun?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I hit a bankrobber with a frozen chicken.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I came out here one summer during college. It was the campaign to stop the dam in the Grand Canyon. I loved it here. I came back, worked as a river guide and eventually stayed year-round. When a Park Ranger job came open, I applied.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I'm still waiting for the chicken.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: The local Parks Department wasn't sure how I'd do with the law enforcement part of the job. Well, one night I was coming home from the store and Tommy Drewson part of the local brain trust was robbing old Bob Kearney in front of the ATM. I bear old Bob yelling and I see Tommy heading for his car, so I tossed a bag of groceries at him at thirty miles an hour. A frozen chicken in the bag hit him in the forehead and he dropped like a rock. Next thing I know, I'm a Ranger. Hale looks at Terry with a new appreciation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins pilots the Humvee along the trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale and Terry are crouching behind a rock, looking down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A zodiac raft has been pulled up on the river bank. A man an Uzi -- SHEPPARD -- waits, duffel bag by his feet.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Get me a frozen Zacky's fryer and he's a dead man. There's the sound of an approaching engine. Sheppard stan gun ready. The engine stops. A few seconds later...

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Appears, walking down a footpath toward Sheppard.

dialogues.speaker: SHEPPARD
dialogues.text: Where is everyone?

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: I am everyone. Let's go. Sheppard hurries to Deakins. They disappear up the footpa

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: We're the only ones who know what's going on, and I don't have the faintest idea how we're gonna stop them.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You'll think of something.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Why do you say that?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You have so far. Hale looks at Terry -- she's right. But it almost pisses off more than it gives him confidence. He grumbles to him and starts off down toward the raft.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Sink it?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Steal it. They get down to the raft. They climb in. Hale grabs the engine throttle, slumps.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Keys. Hale looks around, spots Sheppard's duffel bag lying on t riverbank. He hops out and starts rummaging through it wh they hear grunting and feet approaching. Hale looks around for a place to hide. There isn't any. T tries to get out of the raft, but she trips on a tarpauli bunched on the bottom of the raft. she drops.

dialogues.speaker: WITH DEAKINS AND SHEPPARD
dialogues.text: Coming down a path, lugging the last remaining nuke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of the raft. Hale and Terry are nowhere to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Is alone, in the water, on the far side of the raft, very silent. He hears Deakins and Sheppard load the nuke into raft.

dialogues.speaker: SHEPPARD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Why were you driving around with a dead guy?

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Because I like him. He doesn't ask a lot of annoying questions. All right? A few seconds later the engine starts up. Hale ducks down water as the raft takes off over him. He surfaces to watc raft zooming off into the distance. He is very worried.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE RAFT
dialogues.text: The nuke is on a pallet in the middle of the raft. Sheppa pilots the raft. Deakins looks around, sees what he wants

dialogues.speaker: A TARP
dialogues.text: Is lying on the deck of the raft along one side, all bunc It'd be the kind of thing you'd hide under.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Grabs the tarp and pulls.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE TARP
dialogues.text: There's no one there.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Throws the tarp over the nuke. As he does, we PAN OVER to

dialogues.speaker: A LONG CRATE MARKED "LIFE JACKETS"
dialogues.text: Strapped to one of the side pontoons. A small triangle of is sticking out from inside the crate -- like the corner shirt. It's quickly pulled out of sight from within.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE RIVERBANK
dialogues.text: Hale climbs out of the water and looks around, not knowin what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The zodiac boat is on the shore. Sheppard and four man -- them the GUNMEN -- are hauling the nuke to the truck. Dea walks with another man -- MAX, 50s. Max checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Your friends in Washington should be getting the package about now.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: I wish I could see their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baird, the Chairman, Creeley and the others are all stari slack-jawed at a TV screen.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TV
dialogues.text: Camcorder shot of Deakins against a black backdrop.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: ... two-hundred-and-fifty million dollars, by nine a.m. Utah time. The depositing instructions are in the envelope that came with this tape. This deadline is not negotiable, and there is no grace period. The device is on a timer. Shortly after you receive this, the timer will be activated. At nine a.m., I will make a call. If I find out you've done as you've been told, I will stop the timer. If you have not complied -- The screen suddenly cuts to a flurry of images of nuclear destruction -- buildings being knocked sideways, mushroom clouds, shockwaves, fires.

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: Turn that off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale runs along the shoreline, headed for...

dialogues.speaker: A MARINA
dialogues.text: Where houseboats are rented out. Hale's eyes focus on a s with a picture of a phone on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back gate of the truck is shut from the inside. The t starts up and rumbles off, slowly at first.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Jumps up from the raft and runs after the truck, staying behind. She grabs a handhold and pulls herself up. She ho on tight as the truck bounces off down the dirt road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loud voices and crosstalk. Baird is on the phone, nodding

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Creeley's phone rings. He answers it.

dialogues.speaker: CREELEY
dialogues.text: Creeley.

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: (covers phone; to

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: The President wants to know if we know where the device is headed.

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: If Deakins had a plane waiting, it could be anywhere. We just don't know.

dialogues.speaker: CREELEY
dialogues.text: I do. (all eyes on him) Major Hale is alive. According to him, Colonel Deakins is headed for Salt Lake City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Army helicopters are landing near the marina. Two are alr down. One has TROOPS standing outside of it.

dialogues.speaker: HALE, WILKINS AND GILES
dialogues.text: Are walking toward the second helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: We found the raft on the other side of the lake. Tracks from a heavy truck ran out when they hit the paved road.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: If we get a rad scanner we can track them. A brief look between Wilkins and Giles.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: Actually, Major, we're going back to McMurran.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: We'd just like to ask you a few questions.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I'm not wasting time answering questions. We've got --

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: No debate, Major. I was given orders. Now, you can come with us, or you can go with them. Wilkins nods over at the other helicopter. The troops sta in front of it are MPs. Hale looks at Wilkins, astounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilkins is up front with the pilot. Hale and Giles are in All wear headsets. Hale is yelling at Wilkins.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Deakins thinks I'm dead. He thinks it's over. You've got to let me go after him. I can help. I know how his mind works.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: Major, I know this is personal for you, but I think we can handle it. We're putting a wall of men and machines around Salt Lake City as we speak. That truck is not getting through.

dialogues.speaker: THE NUCLEAR WEAPON
dialogues.text: Dusty slices of light come through the truck's slatted wa The nuclear weapon is lashed to a hammock, straps running D-rings on the sides. Max is hooking up an electronic tim

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: What about the Ranger?

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: What about her?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: When you find that truck, you'll hit it hard. Chances are she'll be killed in the crossfire. "Regrettable but unavoidable."
Giles and Wilkins share a look -- Hale is right.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Look, she's not supposed to be there. She should be checking camping permits, finding lost kids. She... (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She saved my life. Giles wants to help. So does Wilkins, but...

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: We were ordered to take you back to McMurran. You understand what orders are, don't you, Major? Wilkins turns away. Hale sits back, mind racing, not know what to do. He quickly grabs a pistol from the helicopter weapons rack and puts it to Wilkin's neck.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: Major, put that away or say goodbye to your career and hello to twenty years in Leavenworth.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: If that's what it takes.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: You'll have to shoot me. Hale thinks, but there's no way he can do that. He lowers gun, sits back. Giles gets Hale's attention, then points to his own head. doesn't understand, so Giles grabs Hale's gunhand and put gun up to his head.

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: Colonel! How about this? Wilkins looks back, sees Hale holding the gun to Giles' h

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: (bad acting) I swear to God I'll shoot. Wilkins grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max finishes hooking up the timer. He looks at Deakins.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Ready when you are.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Wait until I get back. I'm going to check on Sheppard. Deakins goes to a ladder that leads up to the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale is looking back and forth between what he sees out t window and the map on his lap.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're looking for, Major. Every road between here and salt Lake has already been sealed.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Deak would know that. Maybe he's not on the road. Wilkins doesn't understand.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: They were using maps like these to set up the roadblocks?

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: Yes...?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Then that's the answer. Wilkins doesn't understand. Hale points outside, down at.

dialogues.speaker: TRAIN TRACKS
dialogues.text: On the ground. Old ones, half-covered by weeds.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: It's an old spur. Probably hasn't been used in twenty years. Nobody bothered to put it on the new maps.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: What are you --?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: The nuke isn't in a truck, Colonel. It's on a train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A freight train -- engine, a car carrier (carrying a load Toyotas), several boxcars and a caboose. A hatch opens up the roof of one of the boxcars near the tail of the train

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Climbs out and we discover that indeed they are not in a they're in a train. The "nuke boxcar" has a small satelli dish mounted on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOUR GUNMEN
dialogues.text: Are in position at points along the train, ready with Uzi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilkins hangs up the radio mike.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: Radio's still down. We'll head north, look for a phone, then look for a train. Giles nods. Hale is thinking. Wilkins starts to tell the

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: No. Go south.

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: Salt Lake is north.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: He's not going to Salt Lake.

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: But you said it would be Salt Lake. You found that hospital tag.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: He planted that. He wanted whoever found it to think that's where he was going. (Shakes head) He's been doing a rope-a-dope. Giles and Wilkins look at him like he's nuts.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: It's a boxing term. When Ali -- Look, I know this guy. If everything has been saying he's heading north, then he's heading south. They look at him, then Wilkins grabs the map.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: What's south of here?

dialogues.speaker: ECU MAP
dialogues.text: Wilkins' finger follows the train line on the map. It goe right into Las Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: No. Not Vegas. What the hell is there to blow up in Vegas? Wilkins' finger keeps moving on the map.

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: The President. Wilkins' finger stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins jumps the gap between two boxcars and walks on. W ANGLE DOWN to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Crouching down between the two cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheppard is working with a torch, welding the brake and accelerator controls. Deakins enters. Sheppard turns the down. Deakins lights a cigarette off it.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: How much longer?

dialogues.speaker: SHEPPARD
dialogues.text: Almost done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the driver's compartment is the engine itself, wit walkways along either side.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Creeps-up to one of the doors that lead into the driver's compartment. She hears...

dialogues.speaker: SHEPPARD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: How long until the helicopter gets here?

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Five minutes. We'll leave from the boxcar roof.
Deakins turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins opens the door and strides along beside the engin

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Is hiding on the other side of the engine, very quiet and As Deakins goes out the back door of the engine, Terry fo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry comes out the door and is about to step across to t ladder on the boxcar when we PULL BACK to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: As he puts a gun to the back of Terry's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RANCHER comes out of the mini-mart with a cup of coffee heads for his old pickup truck. He starts to open his doo he hears, incongruously, whump-whump-whump. He looks up a

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS' HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Comes in, gets about three feet off the ground and Giles out. As Giles runs to a payphone, the helicopter pulls up flies away, leaving the Rancher agog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry comes down the ladder from the hatch, followed by D with a gun.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Terry, Max. Max, Terry.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (to Terry) A pleasure. (to Deakins) What the hell is a "Terry" and why is it still live?

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: She asked me how I thought I was going to get away with this and I thought I'd tell her. (to Terry) We're going to a cabin in the mountains, not far from here. When we get there I'm gonna make two phone calls. (MORE)
DEAKINS (cont'd) The first is to the Pentagon. I'm gonna tell them where the train is. (GRINS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, all their forces are up at Salt Lake by now. By the time they could get a F-15 down here the train will be on the outskirts of Vegas. And I'll remind them about the impact trigger -- if they hit this train hard, the nuke'll blow. (shakes head) They won't have any choice. They'll have to let the train get into the city and because of that, they'll have to pay.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You said two phone calls.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: The second will be to my bank in Geneva. If the money's in my account, I use this... (pulls out what looks like a modified cell-

dialogues.speaker: PHONE
dialogues.text: ... and shut down the timer. If not, we sit back, put on some shades and get a quick tan.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: But -- radio isn't working.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: You saw the dish on the roof? Microwave. It's not affected by EMP. See? I really have thought of everything.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You kept her alive just so you can impress her with how smart you are?

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: (to Max) No, I kept her alive because I want her to do me a favor. See, if something goes wrong and this thing goes off, a half a million people are going to be vaporized. I don't want that on my conscience. So I'm not going to arm the nuke. (MORE)
DEAKINS (cont'd) (puts gun to Terry's

dialogues.speaker: HEAD
dialogues.text: She is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is silent. Everyone is looking at video monitors showing a map of Las Vegas. They are listening to a nervo ASSISTANT as he uses a telestrator to diagram the blast e

dialogues.speaker: AIR FORCE ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Starting at ground zero and moving out, we have, in terms of immediate effect, one hundred percent fatalities to thirty miles. Ninety percent from thirty to forty miles, dropping roughly ten percent for every-ten miles after that. The long term --

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: (cut to the chase) Son?

dialogues.speaker: AIR FORCE ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: (looks up, seared) Two hundred and fifty thousand in the first few seconds. The same again within a year.

dialogues.speaker: BAIRD
dialogues.text: (it sinks in) Good God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry is shaking, tears in her eyes, as she slowly-enters numbers Deakins tells her to in the nuke timer keypad.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Nine ... Then pound ... Good. Now six ...

dialogues.speaker: ECU TERRY'S EYES
dialogues.text: Filled with tears. She blinks and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry has visions of RETIREES in Vegas, watering potted p outside their motor home, of TEENAGERS ragging on each ot they walk to school, of CHILDREN in a playground.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Seven ... Star ... One...
And Terry shakingly pushing each button and then... The images of the retirees, the teenagers and the childre bleach out to white, fast, as if hit by a nuclear blast.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Then ENTER and it's done.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Her finger hovers over the ENTER button, almost pushes it shifts to CANCEL and pushes that.

dialogues.speaker: ECU NUKE TIMER
dialogues.text: The display goes blank.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Stunned. He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Ooh. You really shouldn't have done that. I said I would kill you, and I will.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I'm gonna be dead either way. I don't want any part of this. Deakins shrugs -- he sees her logic. He puts his gun to T head. Terry shuts her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Night-night. Deakins is about to pull the trigger when Max stops him. gestures -- listen. They hear a helicopter approaching. M checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: They're early. Just then, they hear gunfire. Max gives Deakins a look.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: It's not a problem. Set the timer, then kill her. Have fun with it. Deakins starts climbing up the ladder to the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GUNMAN at the caboose is firing on Wilkins's helicopt hanging a hundred yards off the back of the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max holds a pistol on Terry with one hand while he quickl the timer with the other.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY'S HAND
dialogues.text: Rests on Max's tool tray. Her fingers creep over to a vre

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Presses ENTER and finishes setting the timer.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY AND MAX
dialogues.text: Terry swings hard and fast with the wrench, knocking the of Max's hand. Max spins, and when Terry swings at him ag Max kicks the wrench out of her hand, then steps up fast hits Terry under the chin with the heel of his hand. She straight back.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Thought I was just friendly old Max, huh? Lady, I was a Navy SEAL. You should see what I can do with just my thumb. Max goes for his gun.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY'S HAND
dialogues.text: Grabs onto something. It's the wrench.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY AND MAX
dialogues.text: As Max turns back with the gun, Terry heaves the wrench. hits Max square in the forehead. He drops like a rock.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well, you should see what I can do with just a chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins joins his man on top of the caboose, firing on Wi helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilkins and Hale are returning fire. Hale points at Deaki

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: That's him!

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: (to pilot) Get him!

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: They've got guns!

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS
dialogues.text: You've got a helicopter. Use it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins and the gunman keep firing on the helicopter as..

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Comes swooping in.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Sees what's going to happen and turns and runs as...

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Drops down beside the train. The rotor blades whip about feet over the train roof and the pilot starts forward.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS AND THE GUNMAN
dialogues.text: Run from the blades as fast as they can.

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Closes fast.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS AND THE GUNMAN
dialogues.text: Jump from car to car. The gunman passes Deakins. Just whe helicopter blades are about to catch up to Deakins...

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Jumps down between two boxcars and the rotor blades go ri over his head. Deakins hears an awful sound and a scream short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swooping fast over the train when suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Pops up out of the hatch, her back to the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: HALE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Pull up!

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Pulls up fast.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Watches the helicopter bank away. Bullets-start whizzing

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Has climbed up and is shooting at her.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Runs away from Deakins, shooting Max's pistol behind her

dialogues.speaker: TWO GUNMEN
dialogues.text: Appear two cars ahead of Terry and start toward her, shoo

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Is caught between Deakins and the gunmen with no way out

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Comes along the length of the train, flying low. It rises and there's...

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Hanging from the helicopter on a cable hooked to a harnes he's firing a pistol, shooting right over Terry at...

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST GUNMAN
dialogues.text: He's hit, falls off the train.

dialogues.speaker: THE SECOND GUNMAN
dialogues.text: Aims at Terry and starts firing.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: The bullets rip up the boxcar roof around her. She jumps grabs onto...

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: As he swings in on the cable, shooting his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Are lifted up and over...

dialogues.speaker: THE SECOND GUNMAN
dialogues.text: Who turns, firing a shotgun. Hale's bullets find him. He

dialogues.speaker: SHEPPARD
dialogues.text: Appears, firing an Uzi at Hale, Terry and the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Bullets rip through. Wilkins is hit, knocked back.

dialogues.speaker: THE CABLE HOLDING HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Is severed by one of Sheppard's bullets.

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Drop ten feet to the roof of a boxcar. Hale shoots as the

dialogues.speaker: SHEPPARD
dialogues.text: Is hit and drops.

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Banks away fast, making ugly sounds, smoke billowing out. engine cuts out and the helicopter drops to a hard landin beside the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Watch the helicopter land as the train rolls on. They loo each other.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You stop the nuke. I'll stop the train. Hale nods. Terry starts forward, then turns.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I'd yell at you for coming after me, but you did just save my life. Hale grins. They hear a helicopter in the distance. They over to see...

dialogues.speaker: A RED CROSS HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Coming in fast.

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Any excitement turns to confusion when they see...

dialogues.speaker: A MAN
dialogues.text: Standing in the doorway of the Red Cross helicopter, hold gun.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: That's Deakins' escape route.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Not any more. Terry nods. They share a last look, then Terry heads off. coils up the winch cable, slings it over his shoulder and for the nuke boxcar and his old friend Deakins. He picks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left by deceased Gunman #2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes her way past the Toyotas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilkins and the pilot stand outside their disabled helico The train is way off in the distance. They hear honking a turn to see...

dialogues.speaker: A PICKUP TRUCK
dialogues.text: Tearing toward then along a dirt road, horn honking.

dialogues.speaker: PICKUP
dialogues.text: The RANCHER from the mini-mart is driving; Giles beside h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry comes into the driver's compartment. She tugs at th brake and accelerator levers. It's useless. She looks aro spots a cigarette lighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins and the one remaining GUNMAN hear the helicopter. start toward the ladder to the roof hatch when they hear footsteps on the roof of the car. Deakins gestures to the gunman. He raises his gun, trying to figure out where to Then they hear someone tugging at the hatch handle. The g opens fire on the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets stream up through the hatch cover, but Hale is no in sight. One end of Hale's helicopter winch cable is tie the hatch cover.
We follow the cable fast, over to the side of the boxcar find...

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Standing, tugging on the cable, still attached to the har Hale racks a load in the shotgun and jumps back off the s the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunman hears a sound, starts to turn, just as...

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Swings into the boxcar on the cable, firing the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: THE GUNMAN
dialogues.text: Is picked up by the blast and smashed back through the wo wall of the boxcar and out of the train.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Climbs up fast through the hatch to the roof.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Shoots at Deakins, misses. The shotgun clicks empty. Hale tosses the gun then unhooks the cable from the harness. H drops to the floor-of the boxcar and runs to the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry has a three-foot length of gasoline-soaked cloth st into the gas tank opening of a Toyota on the lower level car carrier. She lights it and hurries off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deakins steadies himself as...

dialogues.speaker: THE RED CROSS HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Hovers in sideways toward the train. The MAN in the doorw holds out a hand to Deakins.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Is reaching for the man's hand and grabs it when...

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Reaches out of the hatch and grabs onto Deakins' foot.

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Deakins kicks free of Hale, holds onto the man in the hel and is pulled onboard.

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Moves sideways over the train.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Deakins turns, pulling his gun and shoots down at the tra

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Moves back sideways over the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sign of Hale on the train roof.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Get us out of here!

dialogues.speaker: THE PILOT
dialogues.text: Nods and starts to lift and bank. Then he gets an odd expression. The helicopter isn't doing what he wants.

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Is hovering over the train, but it can't fly away because

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Is hanging onto the skids and he's hooked the cable to th The other end of the cable is still attached to the hatch

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Strains against the cable, but it doesn't snap.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: POWER LINES
dialogues.text: Cross the track, a quarter-mile ahead.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Leans out of the helicopter with his Uzi, shooting down a

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Who grabs onto the cable and slides down it to the roof o train, bullets plugging in all around his. He jumps down through the hatch as...

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Sees what's coming and jumps.

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Hits...

dialogues.speaker: THE POWER LIKES
dialogues.text: Which snap, shoot sparks and wrap around the helicopter's

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Breaks up and flies apart as the train rolls on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flame burning up the gas-soaked cloth goes into the T gas tank and...

dialogues.speaker: THE TOYOTA
dialogues.text: Explodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale gets to his feet, goes to look at the nuke.

dialogues.speaker: ECU NUKE TIMER
dialogues.text: Five minutes and counting.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Looks at it, trying to figure out how to disarm it. He he the whoosh-thump of someone jumping down into the boxcar. turns.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Stands there, trying to smile, trying to be cool, but...

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: They would've paid and I would've stopped it. You've made a very, very big mistake.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: It's over, Deak. I beat you. Disarm it.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: If it's over and you beat me, you disarm it.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Deak...

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Course you are going to need this. (holds cell-phone

dialogues.speaker: REMOTE
dialogues.text: All you have to do is get it. (puts remote in

dialogues.speaker: POCKET
dialogues.text: And if you do, as a special added bonus, you get this. Deakins pulls out...

dialogues.speaker: THE TWENTY DOLLAR BILL
dialogues.text: Then pockets it.

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Share a look. Deakins puts up his fists.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Ready? Hale puts up his fists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a chain reaction, with one flaming Toyota setting of one above it or next to it.

dialogues.speaker: BETWEEN BOXCAR AND CAR CARRIER
dialogues.text: Terry is looking under the car carrier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train car axle is smoking, grinding, glowing red in t from the flaming Toyotas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale and Deakins circle each other.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Modern boxing is a pussy sport. They want to make it about scoring points. It's not about scoring points! It's about this!
Deakins fakes a right, jabs with his left, catching Hale chin. Hale is jarred. Blood runs from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Okay. You're bleeding. Good. In the old fights, there'd be so much blood, guys would slip and fall. Let's see if we can't get a little more of that red goo out of you. Ready? Again Deakins fakes right, jabs left. Hale half blocks it is sent back.

dialogues.speaker: CU TRAIN AXLE
dialogues.text: The axle is bending, grinding, groaning.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Is between the car carrier and a boxcar, looking down at axle, not knowing what the hell she's going to do when sh a horn honking. She turns.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Used to be, every fight was to a knockout. You know what happens when you get knocked out? It's your brain slapping against the inside of your skull. Here. I'll let you see what it's like. Ready? Deakins steps toward Hale, about to finish him off. Deaki swings. Hale ducks, comes up hard with all he's got, gets Deakins under the chin and Deakins sails up and back, lan prone, seeing stars.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Stands over Deakins, in silhouette, the light of the hatc him. And then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snaps and...

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: Jumps the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale is thrown off his feet.

dialogues.speaker: THE NUCLEAR WEAPON
dialogues.text: Swings wildly in the hammock webbing.

dialogues.speaker: THE STRAPS
dialogues.text: Securing the webbing to the walls of the car start to sna

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front cars accordion sideways off the tracks, down a steep, embankment. It's all grinding, twisting, groaning

dialogues.speaker: FLAMING TOYOTAS
dialogues.text: Fly, tumble, explode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale tries to get to his feet, but then the floor starts dropping below him as...

dialogues.speaker: THE NUKE BOXCAR
dialogues.text: Goes down the steep slope of the embankment and stops.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: The sounds of the crash cease. Dust and smoke. Burning To

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flickering light from a burning Toyota comes in through t slatted walls. In this weird light, Hale sees...

dialogues.speaker: THE NUCLEAR WEAPON
dialogues.text: It's above him, at the end (top) of the car. It's hanging mid-air, tangled up in the webbing. Two straps are the on things keeping the nuclear weapon from dropping twenty fe the bottom of the car.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Is lying at the bottom (end) of the car, directly under t nuke, not moving.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Looks around for something. He sees it --

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS' REMOTE CONTROL DEVICE
dialogues.text: On the floor.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS' EYES
dialogues.text: Flicker open. He sees...

dialogues.speaker: A PISTOL
dialogues.text: Lying a few feet away.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You have to push amber, then red. You might have time to push amber. You won't get to red. Hale turns to see...

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Pointing a gun at him.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: The nuke is armed, Deak. If it falls, the impact trigger will set it off.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Half a million people will die.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: (thinks, shrugs) Fuck 'em if they can't take a joke.

dialogues.speaker: ONE OF THE STRAPS
dialogues.text: Holding the nuke tears through. One strap left.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: His finger hovers over the amber button.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Do it and I shoot. Hale looks at Deakins.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I guess you really don't know me that well after all. Hale presses the amber button.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Shoots.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Spins back, blood spraying from his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: THE REMOTE
dialogues.text: Falls from his hand.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: Is about to shoot again, then hears a tearing and looks u

dialogues.speaker: THE LAST STRAP
dialogues.text: Rips through and...

dialogues.speaker: THE NUKE
dialogues.text: Drops toward him, point first.

dialogues.speaker: HALE'S BLOODY HAND
dialogues.text: Grabs the remote and his finger presses the RED button.

dialogues.speaker: ECU NUKE TIMER
dialogues.text: Mid-air, dropping, the clock and display go blank as...

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS
dialogues.text: His eyes fill with true terror as...

dialogues.speaker: THE NUCLEAR WEAPON
dialogues.text: Punches into Deakins, point first, crushing him.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Gets to his feet and stands over Deakins. He reaches down opens Deakins' pocket and pulls out the twenty-dollar bil

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Ready. He heads out of the boxcar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hale climbs out of the boxcar and starts running through train wreckage and burning cars, looking for Terry.

dialogues.speaker: A TV NEWSVAN
dialogues.text: Pulls up and a REPORTER and CAMERAMAN jump out.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Keeps running through the wreckage. He stops, unable to b when he sees...

dialogues.speaker: A FOOT
dialogues.text: In a boot, sticking out from under a burning Toyota.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Runs to the car, pulls at the foot, tries to push the car the body underneath. O.S. another vehicle drives up.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Come on! Oh, God. Oh, no. Hale is pulling hard on the foot when...

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: The Air Force pays you so little you have to steal shoes off dead people? Hale turns to see...

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Walkins over from the Rancher's pickup truck.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINS AND GILES
dialogues.text: Are behind her, grinning.

dialogues.speaker: HALE AND TERRY
dialogues.text: Run to each other. They embrace, start smoothing each oth hair, start wiping blood off each other's faces, start ki only to be interrupted by...

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: What happened here? Hale and Wilkins and Giles share a look.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Uh... (looks at flaming

dialogues.speaker: TOYOTAS
dialogues.text: ... somebody was trying to steal some Toyotas.
The reporter asks more questions. Hale and Terry walk off around each other. As they go, Hale sticks out his hand t Terry.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Rawley Hale.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Terry Carmichael. They shake hands and walk on as we...
